title: Domaine du Cellier Aux Moines 2017 Les Pucelles Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)
description: The slightest touch of fresh pineapple hovers above corn husk, lemon and hazelnut notes on the nose of this wine. The palate knits together in a firm texture that relies on creaminess and concentration. Lemon oil notes set an aromatic accent amid corn-husk resonance and richness. Pure lemon dominates the finish.

title: Domaine Pellé 2018 Morogues  (Menetou-Salon)
description: This succulent, juicy wine has ripe cherry flavors, generous tannins and freshness all at the same time. Acidity and fruitiness hold the wine together and promise aging. Drink from 2021.

title: Domaine la Croix des Vainqueurs 2018 Le Bouchet Moelleux  (Vouvray)
description: A proportioned and poised wine, this manages successfully to balance intense honeyed sweetness and well-honed acidity. Still young and with a great future ahead of it, the wine is already impressive. Drink from 2022.

title: Saget la Perrière 2014 Château de la Mulonnière L'Effet Papillon  (Savennières)
description: This is now a rich, mature Chenin Blanc. Its name indicates that fruit comes from the famed Clos du Papillon vineyard of Savennières, giving the wine ripeness and density. The acidity and quince flavors harmonize well. Drink now.
designation: Château de la Mulonnière L'Effet Papillon

title: Amorotti 2017  Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo
description: This stand-out Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo starts off with an engaging nose of fresh-pressed cherry, lemon oil and crushed herbs on the nose. An earthy, brambly base note underpins it all. There's weight, presence and grip to the palate, driven by pulsing flavors of Morello cherry and red currant. Gentle tones of rooibos and crushed stone add depth and lift to this textural beauty. Drink now–2022.

title: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2015 Traditions Cullus  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Aged in large barrels, this wine is now mature while still having a vibrant, fruity character. The acidity has been tamed, filling the glass with perfumed white fruits that are touched by spice. Drink this wine now. Suitable for vegans.

title: Domaine Tinel-Blondelet 2019 Arelles  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This wine shows all the minerality and tight texture of a young Pouilly Fumé. It also has apple and spice flavors, shot through with lime and lemon. The wine needs to age, so wait to drink from 2022.

title: Maison Evenstad 2016 Beaurepaire Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: Lifted notes of resin have the merest hint of honey on the nose of this wine. The palate follows up with hazelnutty, lemony richness, bedded on a creamy texture and highlighted with honey overtones that blend with citrus-oil richness. All this centers around a limestone core of freshness, with a chalkiness that has only just started expressing itself.

title: Pierre Prieur et Fils 2014 Cuvée Maréchal Prieur  (Sancerre)
description: This ripe, wood-aged wine is mature. Perfumed and with its spice and black fruits supporting the secondary, smoky flavors, the wine is suave, balanced and totally ready to drink.

title: Villa Guelpa 2018 Longitudine 8.26 Nebbiolo (Vino Rosso d'Italia)
description: Rose, violet and red-berry aromas mingle with a whiff of alpine herb. Juicy and delicious, the smooth, graceful palate features Marasca cherry, blood orange and star anise alongside polished tannins and bright acidity.

title: Comte Henri d'Assay 2018 Comte Henry Commune de St-Andelain Argiles à Silex  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: From flint and clay soil at the high point of the appellation, this wine is textured, bright with bold white fruits behind a tautly mineral texture. The wine will benefit from further aging to bring out its full potential. Drink from 2021.
designation: Comte Henry Commune de St-Andelain Argiles à Silex

title: Domaine Pellé 2016 Le Carroir  (Menetou-Salon)
description: Ripe and juicy, this perfumed wine has a cool character to go with its black-cherry flavors. Partial wood aging has added spice and a smooth texture to the wine's complexity. Drink from 2021.

title: Domaine Philippe Gilbert 2017 Les Chandelières  (Menetou-Salon)
description: Aged for two years in barrel, this single-vineyard wine is just approaching maturity. Rich tannins have softened to bring in the ripe blackberry flavors and perfumed acidity. The wine needs a little more time, so drink from 2021.

title: Maison Evenstad 2017 Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: Lemon creaminess and a hint of hazelnut play on the nose of this wine. On the vivid palate, buffered limestone freshness takes center stage. It's cool, but clothed in rich lemon oil, nutty oak and mellow creaminess. The wine has balance, straightness and length.

title: Château Vincens 2018 Origine  (Cahors)
description: Still totally young, this dense, structured and tannic wine shows strong wood aging flavors. Licorice and bitter chocolate emphasize the wine's youth and fine future. Drink from 2023.

title: William Fèvre 2018 Champs Royaux  (Chablis)
description: A subtle hint of tangerine on the nose dissipates to leave ripe lemon brightness. The palate is concentrated, juicy and fresh, brimming with lemon-edged Mirabelle fruitiness. Chalky depth anchors everything in coolness despite the ripe, rounded vintage.

title: Château de la Crée 2017 Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: Subtle lemon creaminess on the nose of this wine promises texture and freshness. The palate follows through with a chalky core bathed in buffered lemon zestiness. This wine is resonant and round, but anchored in lemony, bright coolness. It's elegant, soothing and moreish, with a lactic finish.

title: Domaine Bernard Fleuriet et Fils 2018 Les Saurins  (Sancerre)
description: A new single-parcel red from this estate, this wine is structured and firm, with a crisp red-currant edge and smokiness from wood aging. The wine's potential is obvious, with tannins and acidity backing up the red fruits. Drink this wine from 2022.

title: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2018 D'Or et Diamant  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This limited-production wine is a selection of the finest grapes from the estate. It is a structured, young wine, tangy and full of zesty acidity. The wine's structure remains important and needs to soften to give richness in the future. Drink from 2022.

title: Cantine di Marzo NV Metodo Classcio Extra Brut 1930 Sparkling (Vino Spumante)
description: Aromas of white stone fruit, bread crust and Mediterranean brush shape the inviting nose. Creamy and fresh, the bright palate delivers ripe apple, pear, pastry dough and hazelnut alongside fresh acidity and an elegant perlage.

title: Liminal 2018 High Canyon Series WeatherEye Vineyard Grenache (Red Mountain)
description: The first thing one notices about this wine is the depth of color for the variety. Coming from the Amphitheater block, the aromas pop in notes of black raspberry, rose petal, pomegranate and crushed rock. Red and black fruit flavors undulate across the palate, showing deftness, richness and detail. The finish goes on as long—longer even than one cares to count. Throughout it all, it retains a sense of balance and freshness. It's a yardstick against which future Washington Grenache will be measured.

title: Brady Vineyard 2018 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Dense aromas of black currant, red flowers and charred meat are wrapped in a rocky edge on the nose of this bottling. There is great cohesion to the palate, where rich red fruits are cut by crushed stone flavors, lifted by savory spice and framed by ample acidity and tannins.

title: Paltrinieri 2019 Radice  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)
description: Made by carrying out the second fermentation in the bottle, this radiant, lightly sparkling wine opens with heady aromas of citrus, violet and a yeasty whiff of bread dough. Bone-dry and delicious, the energized palate delivers tart sour cherry, juicy pomegranate, pink grapefruit and white pepper alongside crisp acidity and a savory hint of saline. One bottle probably won't be enough.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Géneration Dix-Neuf  (Sancerre)
description: This flagship wine is one of a pair of releases that celebrate the 19 generations of the producer. Its structure and ripe, generous black fruits are still developing, sustained by the wood aging and acidity. Age further and drink from 2022. Organic and biodynamic.

title: Austin Hope 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this reliable crowd-pleaser begins with hearty aromas of black currant, black plum, lush oak and caramel, accented by a hint of olive and loads of clove and nutmeg. The mouthfeel is hearty and rich, with just enough tannic weight to balance the creamy black-cherry, caramel and chocolate-ice-cream flavors, which lead to an oaky finish.

title: Birichino 2018 Besson Vineyard Old Vines Grenache (Central Coast)
description: From vines planted in 1910, this wine impresses on multiple levels. Aromas of dark berry, strawberry, dried thyme and turned soil are both rustic and refined. The palate is framed by fresh acidity and a delightful rocky minerality, which give depth to the cranberry, raspberry and herbal flavors.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2016 En Grands Champs  (Sancerre)
description: This sophisticated, ripe wine comes from a high elevation, well-exposed vineyard. Generous and full, the wine has light tannins and spice from wood aging. The structure and black fruits are rich and fully mature, although there is also potential for further aging. Organic and biodynamic.

title: Domaine Vacheron 2016 Belle Dame  (Sancerre)
description: This is a magnificent wine from a producer that has made a name for its red Sancerre. The wine is dark, solid and firmly structured, balanced by rich, dense black fruits that impart great potential. Drink this wine now, but it will be better from 2021.

title: Vina Robles 2018 The Arborist Estate Red (Paso Robles)
description: This is a screamingly good deal, offering both hedonistic pleasure and complexity through a blend of 41% Syrah, 35% Petite Sirah, 12% Grenache and 12% Tannat. Aromas of roasted cherry, smoked meat and cola spice lead into a hearty palate of black currant, roasted game and licorice. It's balanced by bright acidity, making for a sip that will satisfy many.

title: Château de la Crée 2017 La Rue aux Vaches  (Puligny-Montrachet)
description: The nose of this wine is subtle in gentle touches of oatmeal and lemon. The palate then comes in with chiseled precision and lemony intensity. While hints of honey have started to develop, the wine has underlying concentration, with a gorgeously chalky texture. It's taut, bright, stony and long.

title: Domaine Delaporte 2018 Le Cul de Beaujeu  (Sancerre)
description: This rich, full-bodied Pinot Noir is built aroundx solid tannins. At the same time, dense black fruit balances all that structure, yielding a powerful wine that needs time in the cellar. Drink from 2022.

title: Pierre Morin 2016 Bellechaume  (Sancerre)
description: From a parcel of vines in the village of Bué, this wine benefits from the vineyard's south exposure. It has richness, depth and concentration. The dense tannins and bold texture of the black fruits are balanced by acidity and a cool, perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Quinta do Crasto 2016 Reserva Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)
description: A blend of 30 grape varieties from vines at least 70 years old, this wine boasts denisty and a firm structure. It is powered by tannins, dark black-fruit flavors and great concentration, and is an impressive wine that needs time. Drink from 2022.

title: Domaine Bernard Fleuriet et Fils 2018 Anthocyane  (Sancerre)
description: Old vines and fermentation and aging in barrel have produced this richly concentrated wine. Big tannins and black fruits are laced with acidity and minerality from the chalky soil. Drink this ripe wine from 2022.

title: Maison Evenstad 2017 La Garenne Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)
description: Hazelnut and a hint of resin carries the nose of this wine. The palate adds multidimesional richness in tones of lemon oil, saffron, hazelnut and flint—it is steely precision clothed in sumptuous velvet, and will please Burgundy purists as well as richer Chardonnay fans with its creamy finish.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2016 La Demoiselle  (Sancerre)
description: This wine is structured and full-bodied, rich in tannins, black-cherry fruits and hints of green pepper. Wood aging has smoothed the fruit and brought the beginnings of maturity to the wine. Drink from 2021.

title: Château de la Crée 2016  Puligny-Montrachet
description: Evolution is evident in earthy autumn-leaf and calf leather notes on the nose of this wine, clothed in slight smokiness. While carrying these aromas, the palate still seems fresh with lemony energy and drive. It has concentration, chalky texture, power and precision.

title: Domaine du Cellier Aux Moines 2017 Les Chaumées Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)
description: Notes of melted butter strike first on the nose of this wine, followed by lemon and a hint of cinnamon. On the palate, roundness and concentration emanate from a textured, rich core. The finish is fresh and mellow on this rounded, rich wine.

title: Domaine Vacheron 2018  Sancerre
description: From the master of Pinot Noir in Sancerre, this release epitomizes the spicy, perfumed style of wine produced in the region. It also has richness and density, giving a wine that is worth aging for several years. Drink from 2022.

title: Maison Evenstad 2016 Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: Lemon-oil notes on the nose of this wine have a fresh chervil accent and residual hint of reductive flintiness. The palate offers precision, vivacity and concentration. Everything seems to reverberate with richness and freshness. The wine shows an exemplary balance of lemon oil, vanilla, toast and creaminess.
